intro: Stutzia, commonly known as sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. They are characterized by their spiny leaves and showy, often blue or purple flowers. Stutzia species are often used in coastal landscaping due to their hardiness and aesthetic appeal. Their ability to thrive in harsh environments makes them an important component of coastal ecosystems.
